parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions and encourages voting for ANC (Alianța Național Creștină) for the Romanian Parliament and Cǎlin Georgescu for the Presidency of Romania.  This directly refers to specific candidates participating in the elections, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement targeting a wide audience in Bucharest and surrounding areas, clearly intending to reach more than just a few individuals.  The use of Facebook as a platform and the paid nature of the post further supports this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The primary objective of the post is to influence voters in Bucharest to support ANC in the parliamentary elections and Cǎlin Georgescu in the presidential election. The call to "concentrate votes" and the emphasis on the importance of each vote clearly demonstrates an intention to sway electoral outcomes, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post presents information, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting.  It's a clear appeal for votes, not an unbiased presentation of facts or analysis.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion; instead, it's a direct and forceful call to action, urging voters to support specific candidates. The language used is not that of personal expression but of political campaigning.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>435262922971000</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, identified by ad_archive_id 435262922971000, constitutes electoral propaganda.  It directly promotes specific candidates (ANC for Parliament and Cǎlin Georgescu for Presidency), targets a wide audience in Bucharest through a paid advertisement, and explicitly aims to influence voting behavior. The post's language and call to action leave no doubt about its electoral objective.  While the post does not contain a CMF number, this does not negate the fact that it is clearly electoral propaganda. The post's content fulfills all the criteria outlined in Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  The fact that it's a paid advertisement further strengthens the case for it being electoral propaganda. The end date of the advertisement (1732953600) suggests it may have run after the official end of the electoral campaign, further compounding the violation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>ANC</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Cǎlin Georgescu</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>FreeInfo</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
FreeInfo, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 435262922971000), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează explicit candidatul ANC pentru Parlamentul României și pe Cǎlin Georgescu pentru Președinția României, având ca efect electoral influențarea voturilor în favoarea acestora.  Reclama, cu o cheltuială estimată între 200 și 299 RON, a atins o audiență de peste 1 milion de persoane, concentrându-se pe București și zonele limitrofe.  Textul reclamei, care îndeamnă la "concentrarea voturilor" către candidații menționați, demonstrează clar intenția de a influența rezultatul alegerilor, îndeplinind toate criteriile materialului de propagandă electorală conform articolului 36 (7) din LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  Contactul advertiserului este mitimodoran@yahoo.com și +40774658934.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
